Kreatif, Pria Asal Kubar ini Sulap Lahan Karet Jadi Wisata ‘Rumah Kurcaci’
04 Nov 2019, 01:17 by Andreas Trisno



Kreatif, Pria Asal Kubar ini Sulap Lahan Karet Jadi Wisata ‘Rumah Kurcaci’



Kreatif, Pria Asal Kubar ini Sulap Lahan Karet Jadi Wisata ‘Rumah Kurcaci’



Kreatif, Pria Asal Kubar ini Sulap Lahan Karet Jadi Wisata ‘Rumah Kurcaci’


KBRN, Sendawar : Rumah kurcaci kini lagi viral dan naik daun. Tempat wisata kekinian dan kreatif ini terletak di desa Sekolaq Darat, Kecamatan Barong Tongkok Kabupaten Kutai Barat (Kubar) Provinsi Kalimantan Timur.
Lokasinya yang berdekatan dengan wisata alam anggrek hitam endemik di cagar alam Kersik Luway Sekolaq Darat membuatnya mudah dikenal masyarakat.
Meski terbilang baru, namun banyak masyarakat Kubar bahkan wisatawan luar daerah berbondong-bondong ke lokasi wisata unik layaknya dunia fantasi yang tentunya instagramable sebagai spot foto kren.
“Ini udah yang kedua kali datang ke sini. Awalnya tau dari teman terus aku ajak adik sama ponaan ke sini buat foto-foto. Soalnya bagus, ini satu-satunya di Kubar”, ujar Mely remaja asal Kelurahan Simpang Raya, Kecamatan Barong Tongkok saat ditemui RRI di kawasan wisata Rumah Kurcaci, Minggu (3/11/2019) petang.
“Bagus bangat, kalau mau kasi nilai aku beri nilai 10 untuk tempat ini. Harapannya mungkin tambah lagi di hiasannya”, tambah Riksa pengunjung lainnya.
Wisata pemukiman ini memang jadi buruan warga karena lokasi yang mudah dijangkau. Hanya sekitar 30 menit dari Kota Sendawar dengan jalan beraspal mulus.
Namun siapa sangka wisata rumah kurcaci yang berada persis di kebun karet itu ternyata ide kreatif dari Dony Robert sang pemilik lahan.
Pria asal RT.8 Desa Sekolaq Darat ini mengaku tertarik membuat ide wisata rumah Kurcaci layaknya rumah hobbit dalam film Lord of The Rings itu karena terinspirasi dari rumah unik yang pernah dilihatnya dalam pameran di ibu kota tahun 2018 lalu. Tempat itu jadi buruan warga untuk ber-swa foto atau foto selfi. Lalu ada foto yang diunggah warga net di dunia maya atau sosial media jadi viral padahal tempatnya biasa saja. Sehingga ia berpikir untuk menciptakan lokasi wisata unik meski harus mengorbankan lahan karetnya.
“Ide awal itu muncul karena saya lihat animo masyarakat berkaitan dengan foto. Saya lihat yang biasa-biasa saja kaya gerbang jodoh tapi kok orang mau mencari dalam hutan rela berjalan jauh. Yang lebih memperkuat lagi waktu ikut di Dahau dulu saya perhatikan ada satu pondok bambu di pameran, orang suka betul foto disitu. Jadi setelah itu saya berhenti membuat kerajinan rotan dan beralih profesi mulai membangun rumah-rumah kecil,” jelas pria yang akrab dikenal pak Dana itu.
“Ini saya bangun sekitar habis lebaran kemarin (juni 2019). Dibantu teman saya namanya Rodi sudah kaya saudara sendiri. Jadi dia suport saya sampai bisa bangun ini. Kalau yang sudah ada ini sekitar 5 jenis rumah dengan ukuran mini sekitar 2 meter. Semua bahan dari alam, terus kita manfaatkan barang-barang yang tidak berguna kita upayakan supaya ada gunanya,” tambah Dana yang berprofesi sebagai petani dan pengrajin rotan itu.
Dia menjelaskan rumah-rumah mini dan rumah pohon yang jumlahnya sudah belasan buah itu semuanya dibuat dengan bahan alam seperti rotan dan akar-akar kayu. Kemudian atapnya terbuat dari daun rumbia atau ilalang agar benar-benar alami. Rumah pohon juga memanfaatkan pohon karet miliknya. Dengan tinggi sekitar 2,5-3 meter dan dibantu tangga naik.
“Tidak pakai seng semua dari alam. Kebetulan lahan punya sendiri luasnya 100x300 meter. Rencana kedepan lokasi yang 2 hektar ini mau saya buat lebih bagus lagi dipenuhi bermacam-macam bentuk rumah mini, gazebo. Yang 1 hektar untuk parkiran”, katanya.
Soal jumlah pengunjung Dana mengaku tak menentu. Paling Banyak di hari libur atau akhir pekan. Namun dalam dua bulan terakhir jumlah kunjungan makin membludak seiring banyaknya masyarakat yang memposting di media sosial.
“Tergantung cuaca tergantung juga harinya. Tapi kalau jumad sabtu minggu itu yang meledak (banyak pengunjung). Terakhir kami catat 2 bulan berjalan udah 6.000 pengunjung. Mayoritas masyarakat lokal tapi diselingi juga yang dari luar seperti dari Samarinda, Bontang, Balikpapan, Banjarmasin sampai Jawa,” ungkapnya.
“Bahkan termasuk kabid pariwisata dan Kadis pariwisata Kubar bersama dengan kepala dinas pariwisata Provinsi Kaltim. Pernah juga didatangi ibu bupati Kubar, Ibu wakil gubernur Kaltim, istri bupati Penajam Paser Utara sama istri wakil wali kota Balikpapan”, kisah Pria berusia 48 tahun tersebut.
Tempat favorit pengunjung berswa foto adalah rumah pohon serta dinding berbentuk hati dengan latar belakang rumah mini.
“Biasanya mereka suka yang diatas pohon sama yang rumah hobbit itu. Sebenarnya nama rumah kurcaci ini juga idenya pengunjung jadi saya pikir bagus juga kan itu idenya masyarakat ya harus kita terima apa maunya pengunjung,” bebernya.
Meski begitu Dana mengaku belum memberlakukan tarif resmi atau retribusi. Hanya saja ada tarif parkir dan biaya masuk sebesar Rp 2000. Itupun seikhlas pengunjung.
“Memang setiap pengunjung kita catat di buku. Lalu kalau ada yang memberi ya sukarela. Kita tidak bikin karcis disini. Kalau mereka nda ada 2000 pun tetap masuk kita tidak memaksa. Ya itu juga buat bantu-bantu beli paku, kopi buat disini lah”, pungkas pria dengan 3 orang anak itu.
“Karena saya pikir inikan tempat orang membuang kejenuhan rasa cape mau rekreasi. Makanya kita bikin tarif 2000 itu nilai terendah di Kubar ini.
Soal fasilitas memang belum memadai. Baik tempat istirahat pengunjung maupun tempat nginap.
“Ya karena memang baru dibuka beberapa bulan tapi sudah ramai. Makanya belum ada segala tempat nginap. Tapi kalau WC umum ada. Kami juga sekarang mulai tidur disini dengan tempat seadanya dulu. Tapi kedepan kalau sesuai harapan ya kita pasti siap semua. Minimal tempat berteduh kalau hujan. Kalau panas aman karena ini dibawah pohon semua keliling juga hutan”, lanjutnya.
“Termasuk tempat jualan atau lapak. Rencana saya kalau bagus kita beri kesempatan untuk saudara-saudara yang lain membuka peluang usaha disini. Kalau sekarang ini masih sendiri jadi hanya jualan kopi, minuman pabrik aja,” katanya.
Pria kreatif yang kini sudah menimang cucu itu juga punya aturan khusus bagi pengunjung wisata rumah kurcaci.
“Harapan saya disini tidak mesum, tidak bawa minuman keras dan yang paling umum walaupun kita disini belum lengkap segala tempat sampah tapi tetap kita perhatikan,” sambung Dana.
Meski demikian ia bersyukur wisata yang agak jauh dari keramaian dan mendadak viral itu justru membawa berkah bagi keluarganya.
“Ya kita senanglah kan ini membuat orang juga senang. Makanya saya berharap kepada pemerintah kalaupun tidak membantu anggaran tapi minimal memberi suport dan perhatian dan ikut membina. Karena sekarang ini kami benar-benar mandiri tanpa bantuan atau kerja sama dengan pemerintah atau swasta,” lanjutnya.
Yeremia putra Dony Robert yang kini duduk dibangku SMP mengaku ikut membantu ayahnya mencatat seluruh pengnjung.
“Ya bantu bapak. Biasanya sama teman kalau pulang sekolah atau libur kami jaga disini. Nanti semua kita catat termasuk motor-motor orang. Pokoknya dari buka pertama itu sudah bantu. Tapi hari ini pengunjung kurang karena ada razia polisi aja, biasanya kalau hari minggu banyak,” kata remaja 13 tahun itu.
Sementara itu Rodi sahabat Dony Robert mengaku ikut senang koleganya mampu mewujudkan impian membangun wisata foto rumah kurcaci yang awalnya hanya mimpi akhirnya jadi kenyataan.
“Saya kasi semangat, saya bilang jangan pernah kendur dan jangan menyerah. Karena saya lihat prospek kedepan sangat terbuka. Bahkan ini mungkin satu-satunya di Kaltim. Meskipun baru dibuka langsung diserbu masyarakat. Tapi karena di zaman media sosial ini yang bikin cepat terkenal. Bahkan ada youtuber yang datang termasuk RRI ini kita senang sudah membantu promosikan”, tandas pria yang bekerja di Rumah Sakit Umum Daerah tersebut.
“Makanya saya harap kedepan buat lebih inovatif dan menarik lagi karena ini bisa menghasilkan inkam yang luar biasa buat pak Dana”, tutup Rodi yang akrab disapa bapak Devis itu.

Creative, This Man from Kubar Converts Rubber Land to Become a 'Dwarf House' Tour
Nov 04 2019, 01:17 by Andreas Trisno



Creative, This Man from Kubar Converts Rubber Land to Become a 'Dwarf House' Tour



Creative, This Man from Kubar Converts Rubber Land to Become a 'Dwarf House' Tour



Creative, This Man from Kubar Converts Rubber Land to Become a 'Dwarf House' Tour


KBRN, Sendawar: Dwarf houses are now viral and rising. This contemporary and creative tourist spot is located in the village of Sekolaq Darat, Barong Tongkok District, West Kutai Regency (Kubar), East Kalimantan Province.
Its location which is adjacent to the endemic black nature tourism in the Kersik Luway Sekolaq Darat nature reserve makes it easily known to the public.
Although relatively new, but many Kubar people and even tourists outside the area flocked to a unique tourist location like a fantasy world that is certainly instagramable as a photo spot on paper.
"This is the second time I have come here. Initially I knew from a friend that I invited my sister and brother to come here for photographs. The good thing is, this is the only one in Kubar, "said Mely, a teenager from Simpang Raya Village, Barong Tongkok Sub-district when RRI was met in the tourist area of the Dwarf House, Sunday (11/03/2019) evening.
"Very good, if you want to give me a rating I give 10 points for this place. The hope may be added again in the decoration, "added another visitor.
This residential tour is indeed a hunted citizen because of the location that is easily accessible. Only about 30 minutes from Sendawar City with a smooth paved road.
But who would have thought the dwarf house tour that was right in the rubber garden turned out to be a creative idea from Dony Robert the land owner.
The man from RT.8 Sekolaq Darat village admitted that he was interested in making the idea of a Dwarf house tour like a hobbit house in the film Lord of the Rings because he was inspired by the unique house he had seen in an exhibition in the capital city in 2018 ago. The place was hunted by residents to take selfies or selfies. Then there are photos uploaded by net citizens in cyberspace or social media so viral even though the place is normal. So he thought of creating a unique tourist location even though he had to sacrifice his rubber land.
"The initial idea arose because I saw the public interest associated with photographs. I see that mediocre is like a matchmaking gate but how come people want to search in the forest willing to walk far. Even more striking when I took part in Dahau, I noticed that there was a bamboo hut at the exhibition, people really liked the photos there. So after that I stopped making rattan crafts and switched professions to start building small houses, "explained the man familiarly known as Mr. Dana.
"This I woke up around after Lebaran yesterday (June 2019). Helped by my friend, his name is Rodi. So he supported me until I could wake up. If there are already around 5 types of houses with a mini size of about 2 meters. All materials from nature, we continue to use goods that are not useful, we try to make it useful, "added Dana who works as a farmer and rattan craftsman.
He explained that the mini houses and tree houses, which numbered dozens of them, were all made with natural materials such as rattan and wood roots. Then the roof is made of sago palm leaves or thatch to be truly natural. The tree house also utilizes his rubber tree. With a height of about 2.5-3 meters and assisted by stairs.
"Do not use zinc all from nature. Incidentally the land has its own area of 100x300 meters. The future plan for this 2 hectare location I want to make even better is filled with various forms of mini houses, gazebos. One hectare is for parking ", he said.
About the number of visitors Dana admitted was uncertain. Mostly on holidays or weekends. But in the last two months the number of visits has exploded as more people have posted on social media.
"Depending on the weather also depends on the day. But if it's Saturday that week explodes (lots of visitors). Lastly, we noted that in 2 months there were already 6,000 visitors. The majority are local people but also interspersed with those from outside such as Samarinda, Bontang, Balikpapan, Banjarmasin to Java, "he said.
"It even includes the head of tourism and the Head of the Tourism Department of Kubar along with the head of the East Kalimantan Province tourism office. The district head of Kubar, the vice governor of East Kalimantan, the wife of the North Penajam Paser regent, were also the wife of the Mayor of Balikpapan, "the 48-year-old man said.
Favorite places for visitors to take photos are tree houses and heart-shaped walls with a mini home background.
"Usually they like the one in the tree and the hobbit house. Actually, the name of this dwarf house is also the idea of visitors, so I think it's good, right, it's the idea of the community, we have to accept what visitors want, "he explained.
Even so Dana claimed not to impose official rates or levies. It's just that there is a parking fee and an entrance fee of Rp. 2000. And that's sincere visitors.
"Indeed, every visitor we record in the book. Then if anyone gives it is voluntary. We don't make tickets here. If they don't have 2000, they still come in. We will not force them. Yes it also helps to buy nails, coffee is made here, "concluded the man with 3 children.
"Because I think this is a place where people get rid of the tiredness of being tired of recreation. That's why we made the 2000 tariff the lowest value in Kubar.
The matter of facilities is indeed inadequate. Both the resting place for visitors and for staying.
"Yes because it has only been opened for a few months but it is already crowded. That's why there aren't any places to stay. But if there is a public toilet. We are also now starting to sleep here in a makeshift place. But in the future, if we meet our expectations, we will definitely be all ready. Minimum shelter when it rains. If it's hot it's safe because it's under a tree and around the forest too ”, he continued.
"Including the place of sale or stall. My plan is that if it is good, we will give the opportunity for the other brothers to open business opportunities here. "Right now, it's still only selling coffee, factory drinks," he said.
The creative man who now has a grandchildren also has special rules for visitors to the dwarf house tour.
"My hope here is not obscene, do not bring liquor and the most common although we are here not complete all the trash but we still pay attention," continued Dana.
Nevertheless he was grateful that the tour was a bit far from the crowd and suddenly the virus actually brought blessings to his family.
"Yes, we are happy, this makes people happy too. So I hope that even if the government does not help the budget but at least give support and attention and participate in fostering. Because right now we are truly independent without assistance or cooperation with the government or the private sector, "he continued.
Jeremiah, son of Dony Robert, who is now in junior high school, claimed to have helped his father to record all visitors.
"Yes, help me, sir. Usually with friends when we come home from school or on vacation, we guard here. Later we will record everything including motorbikes. Anyway, from the first open it was already helpful. But today there are less visitors because there are just police raids, usually on Sundays, ”said the 13-year-old teenager.
Meanwhile, Rodi, a friend of Dony Robert, said he was happy that his colleague was able to realize the dream of building a tourist photo of the dwarf house.
"I gave it a lot of enthusiasm, I said never let go and don't give up. Because I see the prospects for the future are very open. In fact this may be the only one in East Kalimantan. Although it was just opened, it was immediately invaded by the community. But because in this age of social media that makes it famous fast. There is even a YouTuber who came including RRI. We are happy to have helped promote it, "said the man who worked at the Regional General Hospital.
"So I hope in the future to be more innovative and interesting again because this can produce extraordinary inkam for Mr. Dana", concluded Rodi, who is familiarly called the father of Devis.
